question: India possesses more than half the total number of the worldâ€™s?
explanation:
India\'s buffaloe population was 89-9 million in 1997. This is about half the buffaloe population of the world and about 19 per cent of the total livestock of India.
India ranks first in cattle and buffalo population, second in goat, third in sheep and seventh in Poultry . Although the population of livestock during last 10 years has been stable around 485 million, the buffalo population has increased by 8.91%, while the cattle population has reduced by 6.89%.
